service.name: Claim Tax Benefits
start.p1: You may be able to use this service if Ontario was your home province on December 31, 2018.
start.li2: Employment, a pension, or Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
start.li3: Up to $1000 of interest from Canadian sources, such as a bank or savings account

start.li4.1: Personal code from the Canada Revenue Agency letter
start.li6: Receipts for rent, long-term care, property tax and home energy costs, if you have them
start.p3.3: use this service if you had income from your own business or self-employment.
start.p5: Your must answer extra security questions if you want your notice of assessment immediately after filing. You need information such as previous addresses and banking details to answer these questions.

You cannot register to vote unless you a: You cannot register to vote unless you are able to check both boxes.
The Canada Elections Act gives rules abo: The Canada Elections Act gives rules about elections and voter information. Provincial and territorial governments, members of Parliament, registered political parties, and candidates at election time can have your voter information.
If you are able to check both boxes, Ele: If you are able to check both boxes, Elections Canada will put you on the voter’s list until you file taxes again.
You allow CRA to give your name, address: You allow CRA to give your name, address, date of birth and citizenship status to Elections Canada. Elections Canada uses the information to update voter records.
Would you like to vote in the federal el: Would you like to vote in the federal election?

CRA sends your notice of assessment abou: CRA sends your notice of assessment about 2 weeks after you file taxes.
You can download the notice immediately: You can download the notice immediately after filing by answering security questions. You will be able to print or save the downloaded notice.
The questions ask for information such a: The questions ask for information such as your previous addresses and banking details. You may need to check your records to find the answers.

Answer a question from this list to get: Answer a question from this list to get your notice of assessment immediately after you file with this service:
Your total income reported on a previous: Your total income reported on a previous tax return
If you skip these questions, you will wa: If you skip these questions, you will wait about 8 weeks to get a notice of assessment.
We will use your information to file you: We will use your information to file your taxes. You may get a refund. You may also get these benefits and credits:
up to $443 for one person, $580 if you h: up to $443 for one person, $580 if you have a marriage or common-law partner, and $153 for each child under age 19.
a yearly amount which may be up to $6,63: a yearly amount which may be up to $6,639 for each child under age 6 and up to $5,602 for each child aged 6 to 17.
a government payment that helps with ene: a government payment that helps with energy, sales and property tax. The government usually pays this amount on the 10th day of each month for 12 months.
everyone gets this payment. You get 10%: everyone gets this payment. You get 10% extra if you live in a small and rural community.
an amount based on your situation. You m: an amount based on your situation. You may be able to get DTC if you have applied and CRA approves your application.
Check the box if you gave correct and co: Check the box if you gave correct and complete answers to the previous questions. CRA will file your taxes using this online service. Keep your tax slips or receipts for 6 years in case CRA asks for them.
Use this code if you need to call about: Use this code if you need to call about your taxes or ask for help from CRA by:
You may also be able to get help at a fr: You may also be able to get help at a free tax clinic.
